title: Invalid help message for borrowed function argument

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
For this code
```rust
fn main() {
    let _: Vec<_> = vec![Ok::<_, ()>(vec![0]); 5]
        .into_iter()
        .filter(|&vec| vec.unwrap().len() > 5)
        .collect();
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=0226b59f901fd6c90a0179b3b5485f69))

Compiler produces following output (it's basically the same on all channels)
```
error[E0507]: cannot move out of a shared reference
 --> src/main.rs:4:18
  |
4 |         .filter(|&vec| vec.unwrap().len() > 5)
  |                  ^---
  |                   |
  |                   data moved here
  |                   move occurs because `vec` has type `std::result::Result<std::vec::Vec<i32>, ()>`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
  |
help: consider borrowing the `Result`'s content
  |
4 |         .filter(|&vec.as_ref()| vec.unwrap().len() > 5)
  |                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
help: consider removing the `&`
  |
4 |         .filter(|vec| vec.unwrap().len() > 5)
  |                  ^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0507`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
With invalid help message
```
help: consider borrowing the `Result`'s content
  |
4 |         .filter(|&vec.as_ref()| vec.unwrap().len() > 5)
```
- It's syntactically invalid. 
- It doesn't remove `&` which means it attempts to borrow borrowed value.

Only second help message may help. It works with options the same way.
